et: Middle English, from Middle French or Medieval Latin; Middle French {it}catharacte{/it}, from Medieval Latin {it}cataracta{/it}, from Latin, portcullis
dt: {bc}a clouding of the lens of the eye or of its surrounding transparent membrane that obstructs the passage of light

et: Latin {it}cataracta{/it} waterfall, portcullis, from Greek {it}kataraktēs{/it}, from {it}katarassein{/it} to dash down, from {it}kata-{/it} + {it}arassein{/it} to strike, dash
shortdef: a clouding of the lens of the eye or of its surrounding transparent membrane that obstructs the passage of light
waterfall; especially : a large one over a precipice
